docs.title: Wecome to Hololens 2 Demo Documention
docs.text:
The documentation contains information to replicate the project. It has the hierarchy and thought process of what the components attached to the objects are meant to do.

The site can be shared easily with this tinyurl "https://tinyurl.com/Hololens2Demo".

docs.title: Application Description
docs.text:
The user enters the application:

(There may be a prompt saying that the user has to calibrate the device) The user is met with a UI(User interface) that follows the user's head. It contains toggle and press buttons. The toggle buttons are [[UI/Toggle Drone]], Toggle Pistol, [[UI/Toggle Mesh]], and [[UI/Toggle Enemy]]. The UI can be pinned in space so it stops following the user around. In addition this UI panel can be resized or moved around in space with hand gestures.

There is an [[empty object named scripts]] which contains the scripts to instantiate the GameObjects.

docs.title: Component
docs.text: A component is something that is attached to the a object. A [[script]] is a type of component.

docs.title: Create Box
docs.text:
using System.Collections.Generic;
using UnityEngine;

public class CreateBox : MonoBehaviour {

    public Rigidbody box;
    public GameObject location;
    public Vector3 position;
    private List<Rigidbody> list = new List<Rigidbody>();
    public void MakeBox()
    {
        list.Add(Instantiate(box, location.transform.position, transform.rotation));
    }

    void Update()
    {
        foreach (var item in list)
        {
            if (box.transform.position.y < -10)
            {
                Destroy(item.gameObject);
                list.Remove(item);
            }
        }
    }
}

docs.title: Empty Object
docs.text: An empty object contains no mesh of any sort and is primarily used for organisational purpose such as being a parent of some hierarchy.

docs.title: Gameobjects
docs.text: GameObjects are the most basic ways to describe objects in the scene. Every object in the scene is a GameObject so it is the most encompassing category.

docs.title: Prefab
docs.text:
A prefab is a blueprint object, this means that when editing this object the changes will be applied to every instance of this object being used elsewhere.

The use of this capability is an efficient way to make changes across the entire project without having to manually change in the same way object by object.

docs.title: Script
docs.text: A script is programmed in C# and it can control the state of the game from the game.

docs.title: Setting Up The Enviorment
docs.text:
Download Unity and install the lts (latest) version of the game engine. make sure to select universal UWP(windows platform) and windows when downloading the version.

Follow the tutorial below: XR Step-by-Step 2023! Hololens 2: Setting up your Project in Unity 2022 + MRTK 2.8.3 + Visual Studio 2022 – Lance Larsen – Microsoft MVP – Hololens / VR / AR

Then connect to the Hololens 2 remotely by going in the unity project then Mixed Reality > Remoting > Holographic Remoting for Play Mode.

Inside the Hololens 2 open the App named "Holographic Remoting". Type the ip address seen inside the app into the settings inside "Holographic Remoting for Play Mode" in the unity project. Leave the port as is and make sure to press "enable holographic remoting for play mode".

This should setup the Hololens 2 to be play tested.

docs.title: Random Movement
docs.text: This script is used to move the enemy around in random directions and change direction when it detects a collision with a wall.

docs.title: Toggle Drone
docs.text:
This turns on and off the drone.

In the script managing the toggle feature contains public variables - Drone Prefab - Relative Spawn Location - Number of Drones The Prefab contains additional Script to separate, keep together, and follow a target.

This script is contained in an empty object in the scene, more about it in Application Description.

docs.title: Toggle Enemy
docs.text:
This turns on and off the enemy.

In the script managing the toggle feature contains public variables - Enemy Prefab - Organizational Parent Object - Respawn Boundary Condition - Number of Enemies The Prefab contains several Script: - Animator - Character Controller - Enemy Collision Handler - Random Movement - Parent Rigid Controller - Enemy State

This script is contained in an empty object in the scene, more about it in Application Description.
